bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, August 7, 1941

div1.p: Kean informs Hench of the improvement in Kissinger's health.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, August 7, 1941
div1.opener:
United States Commission
for the Erection of a Permanent Memorial to the Memory of
Thomas Jefferson
1743 -- 1826
COMMISSIONERS
---------
UNITED STATES SENATE
ELBERT D. THOMAS
UTAH
CHARLES L. MCNARY
OREGON
CHARLES O. ANDREWS
FLORIDA
HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
HOWARD W. SMITH
VIRGINIA
FRANCIS D. CULKIN
NEW YORK
FRITZ G. LANHAM
TEXAS
---------
THOMAS JEFFERSON MEMORIAL
FOUNDATION
STUART G. GIBBONEY
DR. GEORGE J. RYAN
DR. FISKE KIMBALL
CHAIRMAN
STUART G. GIBBONEY
VICE CHAIRMAN
ELBERT D. THOMAS
CHARLES O. ANDREWS
CHARLES L. MCNARY
SECRETARY
HOWARD W. SMITH
PRESIDENTIAL COMMISSIONERS
T. JEFFERSON COOLIDGE JOSEPH P. TUMULTY
BRIG. GEN. JEFFERSON RANDOLPH KEAN
--------
EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
STUART G. GIBBONEY
ELBERT D. THOMAS
CHARLES L. MCNARY
CHARLES O. ANDREWS
HOWARD W. SMITH
FRANCIS D. CULKIN
FRITZ G. LANHAM
JOSEPH P. TUMULTY
DR. FISKE KIMBALL
2804 N St N.W.
HOUSE OFFICE BUILDING
WASHINGTON, D. C.
Aug 7, 1941
My dear Dr Hench
div1.p:
The inclosed came from Mrs. Kissin-
ger yesterday, and indicates a remarkable
improvement in Kissinger and a great gain in
moral on her past. Now she knows that whenever
he has a turn for the worse and she wants to
put him in a hospital she can do it, and as
she has been furnished blank forms and instructions
by the Veterans Administration. She knows how to
go about it. That is the V.A. said they would send them
to her. So I think you need not worry about them
for the present.

I am quite interested in the publication of your address
in Hygeia and would like to get that number as I do
not subscribe to it. Please write on a postal the
issue in which it will appear & mail to me.
I am all right again and the weather much more
bearable due to a drops in the humidity rather than
the Max. Temp.
